data.title: RenderTarget2D.SaveAsJpeg NotImplementedException
data.body:
Hi Everyone, 

Im trying to use renderTarget2D.SaveAsJpeg() with iOS build I got System.NotImplementedException: The requested feature is not implemented". Is there any known workaround?

data.title: Rework of #2267
data.body:
Reset w index at end of inner loop.
Clean-up of surrounding code to fit coding guidelines.

I have setdata in the branch name, but it's actually in GetData.

data.title: Bugfix in Texture2D.getData: Copy rectangle data
data.body:
Could lead to an array access out of boundaries and it was simply wrong.
Just adding a w = 0;

data.title: Fix touch input lag that occur on some devices.
data.body:
This is a bug that has been reported on many occasions. I have seen it myself on a custom AMDx86 tablet but on AtivTab is not visible. Others has seen it on Surface Pro and XPS10. 
This comment mono#2113 has been very helpful to track down this bug. It has been speculated that it is due to drivers firing events faster, or that on slow machines events are not consumed as fast. I would like to add the possibility that the quality of the touch screen might be a factor to why we see that on some devices and not on others. The better/more accurate a touch screen is, the more visible this bug is.

I had to close the previews PR f63da1f and resend after the recent changes on TouchPanel/TouchPanelState.

I will try to explain this as briefly as possible. 
TouchPanelState.Refresh(...) is always called inside a while "ex. (touchPanelState.Refresh(...) ) {...}" by making the assumption that this functions returns false when there are no more events to process. 
This function, for every preview touch id, goes through the event list and tries to find the first event with the same id, remove it, and break the loop. Then continues on with the next id and finally with the rest of the program.
In case the event hasn't changed position from last time and there are no other real events, stateChanged remains always =false and the function returns false. This breaks the caller's While() loop and wont be called until the next frame. The problem is that it removes one nonmoving event at a time while the list accumulate similar events for that id. 
The fix is that we keep removing events of that id, as long as stateChanged==false, which is all nonmoving events we can find until we reach a real touch event.
The j-- of course adjust the j indexer after the removal of one element.

data.title: Hide statusbar for iOS 7 or newer if game is fullscreen
data.body: This was previously discussed in #2260

data.title: On Android, rapid switching between home screen and game causes deadlock over ContentManagerLock
data.body:
In attempting to track down a hanging on resume problem on Android in our software, I believe I have identified an issue with content reloading on that platform.

It appears that if you switch out of a game on Android while it is still reloading content, then switch back into it quickly, there is often a second call to CreateFrameBuffer() in AndroidGameWindow while _isResuming is already true and there is already a background thread reloading content.

This means that it starts a new background thread reloading content, but resumes the game as soon as the old background thread completes and sets _isResuming to false. This causes the game to resume running while content is still being reloaded in the new background thread.

Since the background thread for reloading content runs holding ContentManagerLock and invokes the UI thread, if the UI thread attempts to create a new ContentManager while in this state (and thus attempts to acquire the ContentManagerLock), this can cause a deadlock and the game to hang.

If helpful, I could try to create a small project replicating the hanging behaviour. A multicore test device might be needed. I am not sure about appropriate solutions; for this particular hanging issue it might be sufficient to just ensure _isResuming doesn't become false until all background threads reloading content are finished, but there could be other issues with raising OnDeviceReset while reloading content is still ongoing.

data.title: RenderTarget2d as shader sampler iOS
data.body:
Anyone have any success passing a rendertarget2d into a shader as a texture to sample (ie a light mask), specifically on iOS? This seems to work fine when targeting windows (dx11) but not OpenGL. The texture seems to be just black!

Thanks

James

data.title: Now State returns the proper state from the Source on OpenAL (Desktop)
data.body: Otherwise we will never find out when a sound stopped playing. This fix might apply on iOS/Android platforms too, but I cannot test this at the moment.

data.title: Parent directory support
data.body: Added support to load from parent directory using ".." in ContentManager

data.title: BeginShowKeyboardInput fixed for iOS
data.body:
Keyboard input wasn't really working, so I rewrote it. This PR fixes #1689. The new code is much cleaner.

I have also included the hiding of the status bar on iOS 7.

data.title: Split VertexBuffer/IndexBuffer on a per-API basis
data.body: This applies the file splitting methodology from #2243 to VertexBuffer and IndexBuffer. As before, there are no functional or style changes wherever possible.

data.title: 2MGFX failing to compile #include targeting Unicode files
data.body:
As per discussion in Issue #1972, when using `#include` in a FX file to include another file in Unicode, 2MGFX may fail to compile and throw

```
error X3000: syntax error: unexpected token '?'
```

due to a [byte order mark](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte_order_mark) contained in the file to be included.

data.title: Can PR's greater than 3 months old be cleared in light of the protobuild work?
data.body:
Seeing as there are 57 PR's currently still active and unlikely to be merged, can these be cleared down in light of the protobuild work and their likelihood that they are never going to get merged as they are so stale?

Just a thought.

data.title: Initial Window Position can no longer be set in 3.1.3-alpha Nuget Release
Fixing issue #2236 in WindowsGL
data.body:
```
GamePlatform.cs
Line 284: Removed IsActive = true;

OpenTKGamePlatform.cs
Line 145: Runloop - added IsActive = true;
```

Fixes issue #2236 - Game Deactivate fired during startup.
Makes IsActive only get set to true after initialization when the game actually becomes active.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Shumway shumway.danny@gmail.com

data.title: TextureCubeReader ignore existingInstance
data.body:
TextureCubeReader ignore existingInstance. As a result of this on WP8
when the app is deactivated/activated the ReloadAsset fails to reload
the Cube.

I applied the same fix to Texture3DReader although I didn't test it. The
fix is quite simple and should work.

I tried to make the code resemble as much the style of the
Texture2DReader.Read(...)

data.title: Support for skinning information in content pipeline
data.body:
This is some progress I've made today getting skinned models through the content pipeline, and some other enhancements made along the way.
- OpenAssetImporter was missing some bones in its skeleton, trying another technique instead
- Added a TypeConverter for Vertex4 -> Single data.
- Implemented MeshHelper.FlattenSkeleton
- CompiledEffectContentWriter now correctly writes its reader type as EffectReader
- Enhanced some MGCB error messages with file hints where necessary

data.title: Touch positions are bogus on Windows Phone
data.body:
TouchPanel.GetState() returns the collection of touch inputs but for some reason, when i use it, the location for x & y are always infinity. 
Can someone please give detail steps on fixing this problem? Should I just ignore it and deploy to the store in hopes it will just work?

I tried using the latest unstable release but the phone emulator just shows a black screen.

Thanks,
Morgan

data.title: Split SoundEffectInstance/SoundEffect on a per-API basis
data.body:
The goals for this pull request mirror those found in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2243, but for the SoundEffectInstance/SoundEffect classes. We chose to split each file into a XAudio, OpenAL, and PSM paths.

SoundEffectInstance and SoundEffect were split into partial classes, to help separate the code and clarify the growing confusing caused by constant #if/#elseif/#else chains and increase ease of future PRs. This also allows us to pull out common code to the "base" classes so that the behavior of these classes is more uniform.

Note that this pull request is all clean up; There should be no functional changes or new features, but please let me know if any pop up.

While merging these paths together, I did notice a lot bugs and logic errors. I tried to avoid fixing them, as that's a goal for a future PR. It's already confusing enough to view the diff of a restructure like this without changing implementation.

data.title: Fix for wrong auto rotation on iOS
data.body:
iOS has inverted LanscapeLeft and LandscapeRight orientation compared to XNA.
While other methods take that in account, it was missing in ToUIInterfaceOrientationMask, which was a potential source of unwanted auto rotation (overriding SupportedOrientations) and crashes if the rotation resulted in unsupported Info.plist orientations.

See codeplex discussion for details: https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/535677

data.title: Protobuild
data.body:
This pull request starts to add Protobuild (https://github.com/hach-que/Protobuild) support to MonoGame. The work is based on the work @hach-que did in PR #1945.
- Removed old MonoGame.Framework solutions/assemblies.
- Added Protobuild binary and definitions.
- Fixed build script to trigger Protobuild.
- Fixed installer to reference changed assembly output paths.

To generate solutions/projects you simply run Protobuild and it generates everything.  For people running their own build servers you will have to add a step to do that.

The next steps after this is merged to convert the tools (MGCB and 2MGFX) and then the content pipeline tools as Protobuild definitions.

data.title: graphics.isfullscreen = true doesnt work
XNB Files built by Content Pipeline Addin Project Larger than Originals
data.body: I just tried using the new Content Project Addin for Xamarin Studio for OS X (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/wiki/Xamarin-Studio-Content-Pipeline-Addin) and some of the resulting files (when converting PNGs to XNBs) are larger than the originals. I have one instance where the original is 10kb and the resulting XNB is 1MB.  This doesn't seem to be affected by the platform selected it the MonoGame Build settings.

data.title: ConstantBuffer: Fallback to device parameter if GraphicsDevice is null
data.body: Looks like this code references the GraphicsDevice property on itself even though the device is passed in as an argument.  In some situations the GraphicsDevice property can be null, which causes a crash.  This allows the code to fall back to the parameter if that's the case (and everything works correctly as the device that's passed in is guaranteed to be the one being locked by the caller).

data.title: Custom ContentReader problem
data.body:
Hello,
I'm trying to port http://xnagif.codeplex.com/ to monogame.
It compiles, but it can't load the asset anim1 and throws the exception because Normalize < T > (ie: Normalize < GifAnimation  > in fact) always return null because it is not a valid content for monogame.
How to bypass this problem ?

Thanks in advance for your help.

data.title: Textures become black after returning
Split GraphicsDevice on a per-API basis
data.body:
This request cleans up the branching ifdefs and moves API-specific code from GraphicsDevice.cs into partial class definitions for each render API.

There are three goals at work here:
1. Eliminate confusing #ifdef-elif-elif branching
2. Separate platform-specific code while maintaining asserts/exceptions common to all
3. Avoid the performance hit of a base class and virtual methods

The first thing I did was to go through and eliminate nested #elif and catchall #else directives, with each API side by side in its own #if-#endif block. Since you would never have both OPENGL and DIRECTX defined, this is fine and it'd rightly fail to compile if you tried. This is probably worth doing even if we didn't go through with the other steps.

Next I isolated all in-method #if'd logic into methods called Platform{MethodName}. For example, PlatformDrawIndexedPrimitives. Assertions and exceptions common to all APIs stay in the main file to ensure runtime consistency.

Finally, I copied the file out three times, one for each API. Then I eliminated all platform-specific code from the main file, and all non-platform code from the copies. After switching the definition to a partial class in all files, everything compiles normally.

Using partial classes and chaining allows us to completely separate the APIs with only the overhead of a regular (non-virtual) method call. The process of porting is simply a matter of creating a new partial class file with the Platform\* methods in it and adding it to the project file. If the ported file is missing or a Platform method isn't defined, the build fails and it's very easy to see where.

I recommend fetching the changes locally to inspect them side-by-side so it's easier to see what's going on.

data.title: RenderTarget2D - GL DeleteRenderbuffers error when DepthFormat.None
[WP8] Fix missing deactivated event when closing the game
data.body:
Up until now the Deactivated event was not fired on Windows Phone 8 when the game is closed using Game.Exit() (e.g. back button was pressed). This PR fixes this issue.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsphone/develop/system.windows.application.terminate%28v=vs.105%29.aspx

> The Terminate method does not raise any application lifecycle events. Before you call this method, you must save the state of the app.

data.title: Removed ContentReaders linker hacks.
data.body:
Now using PreserveAttribute where needed. Also fixed ReloadAsset method
on Android.
